column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: During May and June 2023, Bunnings supported FightMND for the fifth consecutive year in its efforts to find a cure for motor neurone disease, helping to raise and contribute more than $1.5 million. Beanies were sold in all Australian stores and trade centres via the Bunnings website.
column14: It helped to raise and contribute more than $1.5 million
column20: FightMND, motor neurone disease, Beanie

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: More than $250,000 was raised in the financial year for Target's new charity partnership with the Australian Childhood Foundation, highlighting Target's commitment to supporting women and families. The funds raised by Target and its customers go to the charity's Bringing Up Great Kids Program, which focuses on providing education and resources to vulnerable parents to help them raise happy and healthy children.
column14: More than $250,000 was raised in the financial year for Target's new charity partnership with the Australian Childhood Foundation.
column20: Bringing Up Great Kids Program, charity partnership, Australian Childhood Foundation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column9: Ever Present: First Peoples Art of Australia
column13: Ever Present: First Peoples Art of Australia represents the most significant milestone in Wesfarmers' 12-year partnership with the National Gallery of Australia (NGA). This exhibition charts the evolution of First Nations art in Australia through more than 150 rare and iconic historical and contemporary works by 178 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from across Australia, assembled for a worldwide audience.
column14: This exhibition charts the evolution of First Nations art in Australia through more than 150 rare and iconic historical and contemporary works by 178 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from across Australia, assembled for a worldwide audience.
column20: Ever Present: First Peoples Art of Australia, National Gallery of Australia, a contemporary work

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column8: Ethical Sourcing and Modern Slavery Policy
column13: Wesfarmers' Ethical Sourcing and Modern Slavery Policy aims to ensure the Group sources products responsibly and consistently while working with suppliers to improve their social and environmental practices. Each business must adopt policies and procedures to ensure that suppliers supplying goods for resale through its retail networks comply with all applicable laws and regulations in their operating areas and take all reasonable steps to meet minimum employment standards.
column20: Ethical Sourcing and Modern Slavery Policy, social practice, environmental practice

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Wesfarmers' divisional ethical sourcing due diligence programs vary, consistent with their diverse operations and industries. However, they share a broadly common methodology to assess, identify, manage and mitigate human rights risks, which aligns with leading international practice. Across the Group, suppliers complete mandatory pre-qualification questionnaires and, depending on their assessed risk level, ongoing monitoring if they are included in the ethical sourcing program.
column20: Ethical sourcing due diligence, pre-qualification questionnaire, ongoing monitoring

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Officeworks continued implementing worker surveys to understand better working conditions and employee concerns in its global supply chain. The worker surveys enable Officeworks to engage with workers to identify concerns that might not have been captured during audits and to work with factory management to take appropriate action to embed positive change for workers.
column20: Worker survey, global supply chain, positive change

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Wesfarmers' OneDigital adopted the OneDigital Ethical Sourcing Code (ESC), which includes minimum ethical sourcing standards suppliers must meet to do business with OneDigital. The ESC incorporates core labour standards established by the International Labour Organization, human rights as set out in the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights and Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, modern slavery, business integrity and environmental protection.
column20: OneDigital Ethical Sourcing Code, ethical sourcing standard, core labour standard

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column8: Ethical Sourcing Program Standard Operating Procedure
column13: OneDigital developed the Ethical Sourcing Program Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), which defines the roles, responsibilities and processes within the OneDigital Ethical Sourcing Program. A central component of the SOP is the ethical sourcing audit requirements that apply to factories producing Catch's own-brand retail merchandise.
column20: Ethical Sourcing Program Standard Operating Procedure, responsibility, audit requirement

column6: Political contributions
column7: The Wesfarmers Board must authorise any political donations made by Wesfarmers Limited, disclosed as required by law and recorded in the Wesfarmers Group accounts.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Wesfarmers Health launched the Participative Ergonomics for Manual Handling (PErforM) and Manual Task Risk Assessment (ManTRA) programs launched during the year. PErforM seeks team member insights to develop and implement risk controls. At the same time, ManTRA engages allied health professionals to assess operational tasks against five manual handling risk factors: repetition, awkward postures, excess force, duration and vibration.
column20: Participative Ergonomics for Manual Handling, Manual Task Risk Assessment, risk control

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: WesCEF's hygiene monitoring program ensures that appropriate control measures are identified and implemented if a potential team member is exposed to hazardous chemicals. It may include additional personal protective equipment being worn, additional health monitoring conducted or an engineering solution implemented to eliminate the risk.\t
column20: Hygiene monitoring program, hazardous chemical, protective equipment

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: As a signatory to the ACCC Product Safety Pledge, Wesfarmers' Catch commits to monitor the product safety and compliance of products listed on the Catch platform. Catch provides an annual pledge update to the ACCC and meets twice yearly to discuss emerging issues and process improvements. Catch is continually developing similar relationships with other lead regulators, such as the Therapeutic Goods Administration and electrical and gas products regulators.
column20: ACCC Product Safety Pledge, product safety, compliance

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Wesfarmers' Workwear Group delivered product quality training for suppliers and in-country teams to mitigate the risk of potential non-conformances better. The training module included topics on service level agreements, ethical sourcing guidelines, modern slavery compliance, product quality responsibilities, and trust and verify auditing.\t
column20: Product quality training, supplier, non-conformance

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: During the year, Bunnings maintained its ISO9001 quality certification requirements and conducted third-party inspections for high-risk electrical products. It helps improve transparency on quality indicators for electrical products before shipping to Australia and New Zealand.
column20: ISO9001, third-party inspection, electrical product

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column13: In April 2023, Wesfarmers' Bunnings conducted an independent product safety labelling assessment to identify continuous improvement opportunities. Bunnings also commissioned a review across selected categories of products sold by weight, volume or measurement to monitor compliance with trade measurement laws and consumer expectations.
column20: Safety labelling assessment, continuous improvement, trade measurement law

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning product and service information and labeling
Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: WesCEF undertook a maturity assessment of its data governance program, focusing on securing customer data managed in its consumer-facing businesses. Due diligence was completed on a new enterprise resource planning system for the division, and a multi-year replacement program of work has been approved. Progressing this program of work and managing the security of customer data will continue to be areas of focus for WesCEF in the coming year.
column20: Maturity assessment, data governance, enterprise resource planning

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Wesfarmers' Officeworks has a Data and Privacy Governance Council whose mission is to ensure Officeworks data assets are optimised, effectively managed, secured, compliant and used responsibly and ethically. This mission is achieved by ensuring Officeworks has appropriate systems and human resources while establishing and enforcing policies, procedures and standards that govern data collection, storage, use, destruction and sharing across the Officeworks business.
column20: Data and Privacy Governance Council, data asset, human resource

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: The OneDigital Privacy and Customer Trust team hosted a PAW panel discussion and networking event featuring experts from across the Wesfarmers Group, whom team members across other Wesfarmers divisions joined. The panel discussion took a fun and informative approach in offering 'how to' advice and practical tools on upholding customer trust and the OnePass Privacy Promise.
column20: Privacy Awareness Week panel discussion, Privacy and Customer Trust team, OnePass Privacy Promise

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: A new Privacy 101 Fundamentals training module was launched, covering topics such as the importance of privacy, identification and response to potential data breaches, and setting expectations for team members about how they can help OneDigital meet its customer expectations and regulatory obligations.
column20: Privacy 101 Fundamentals training, privacy, potential data breach

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column8: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard assurance
column13: Where customer cardholder data is managed or handled, Wesfarmers' divisions continue to demonstrate Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard assurance. During the year, Wesfarmers' businesses implemented various customer data initiatives. These included enhancements to security monitoring through security operations centres and web security protective controls.
column20: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard assurance, customer data, web security

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Wesfarmers maintains a data governance framework, including a data governance policy. This policy aligns standard foundational data types to a Group data classification scheme. This approach helps to support the strategic value of Wesfarmers' data assets while balancing security, integrity, compliance and reputational issues inherent in collecting, using, retaining, sharing and destroying or deleting data.
column20: Data governance framework, data governance policy, data asset
